Package fasdpd

Class Analyzer

java.lang.Object
fasdpd.Analyzer
public class Analyzer
extends java.lang.Object
This class computes scores and search the primers in a sequence.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Analyzer​(float pA, float Ny, float Nx, degeneration.GeneticCode myGeneticCode)
    Creates a new instance of Analyzer with custom parameters.
    Analyzer​(degeneration.GeneticCode myGeneticCode)
    Creates a new instance of Analyzer with standard parameters.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    float calculatePrimerScore​(sequences.dna.Primer p)
    Calculates a primer score according to: Eq. 1: Sp_i = 1 - Log_10(NDi)
    Eq. 2: Wp_i = pA + i * (Ny - pA) / Nx
    Eq. 3: Ms = n * pA + (n + 1) * n * (Ny - pA) / ( 2 * Nx)
    Eq. 4: Sg = Suma(i=1,n,Sp * Wp) / Ms
    PriorityList<sequences.dna.Primer> searchBestPrimers​(int numberOfPrimers, sequences.dna.DNASeq seq, int primerLength, boolean directStrand, filters.validator.Validator Filter, int StartPoint, int EndPoint)
    Search primers that have higher scores.
    PriorityList<sequences.dna.Primer> searchBestPrimers​(int numberOfPrimers, sequences.dna.DNASeq seq, int primerLengthMin, int primerLengthMax, boolean directStrand, filters.validator.Validator Filter, int StartPoint, int EndPoint)  
    java.util.List<PrimerPair> searchPrimerPairs​(java.util.List<sequences.dna.Primer> forward, java.util.List<sequences.dna.Primer> reverse, filters.validator.Validator filter)
    Search compatible primers.

  • Method Details

    • searchBestPrimers

      public PriorityList<sequences.dna.Primer> searchBestPrimers​(int numberOfPrimers, sequences.dna.DNASeq seq, int primerLength, boolean directStrand, filters.validator.Validator Filter, int StartPoint, int EndPoint)
      Search primers that have higher scores.
      Parameters:
      numberOfPrimers - is the number of primers that are stored in the result.
      seq - is the sequence where the primers will be searched.
      primerLength - is the length of desired primers.
      directStrand - indicates that the sequence of primers will be search in the complementary strand of DNASeq.
      Filter - is a Validator that checks if the primers meet any additional requirements.
      StartPoint - is the position of DNAseq where the search start.
      EndPoint - is the position of DNAseq where the search Ends. If EndPoint == -1 the search will be done until the end of the sequence is reached

    • searchBestPrimers

      public PriorityList<sequences.dna.Primer> searchBestPrimers​(int numberOfPrimers, sequences.dna.DNASeq seq, int primerLengthMin, int primerLengthMax, boolean directStrand, filters.validator.Validator Filter, int StartPoint, int EndPoint)

    • searchPrimerPairs

      public java.util.List<PrimerPair> searchPrimerPairs​(java.util.List<sequences.dna.Primer> forward, java.util.List<sequences.dna.Primer> reverse, filters.validator.Validator filter)
      Search compatible primers. This method can be expensive, if the input list are large.
      Parameters:
      forward - is a list of candidate forward primers
      reverse - is a list of candidate reverse primers
      filter - gives the selection conditions.
      Returns:
      a list of pairs of compatible primers.

    • calculatePrimerScore

      public float calculatePrimerScore​(sequences.dna.Primer p)
      Calculates a primer score according to:
      • Eq. 1: Sp_i = 1 - Log_10(NDi)
      • Eq. 2: Wp_i = pA + i * (Ny - pA) / Nx
      • Eq. 3: Ms = n * pA + (n + 1) * n * (Ny - pA) / ( 2 * Nx)
      • Eq. 4: Sg = Suma(i=1,n,Sp * Wp) / Ms
      Parameters:
      p - is a Primer object
      Returns:
      the score for a primer.
